Description Text:
This Sources Sought synopsis is for Contractor Engineering and Technical Services (CETS) during the period of 1 January 2026 and 31 December 2030. CETS provides training and technical support to operational U.S. Air Force, Army, Navy and Coast Guard units. In particular, CETS personnel provide expertise and technical guidance on the most complex and intricate technical issues related to the aircraft, systems, subsystems, and equipment identified below. The Government invites interested sources to identify additional platforms not listed below that may require CETS during the time period identified above.


As a result of this Sources Sought synopsis and general market research, the Government may issue numerous sole-source and/or competitive Requests for Proposal based upon the type of aircraft, systems, subsystems, and equipment to be supported. The Government intends to award any resulting contracts between September 2025 or December 2030. The aircraft, systems, subsystems, and equipment requiring CETS support during the stated time period may include, but are not limited to, the following:


Lockheed Martin: F-16 Aircraft; F-16 Avionics; Lantrin Pods; F-16 Rack Mount Intermediate Station and weapons stores management; C-130/E-2D (AN/APY -9 Radar); F-22; C-5; C130H (APG/AV), Aircraft/Systems/Subsystems/Equipment; F-16 AIS Stations; C130-J


Pratt Whitney (Raytheon): F-100-PW-200; (F-15) F100-PW-220/220E/F100 Engine; (F16) F100-PW; F-16 F100 engines and related support equipment; F-100 -PW220/229 Motors; Roving/engine (PT), (FX), Propulsion; DRS Sustainment Systems MC-130H AN/APQ-170 (V) Radar Set


General Electric: F-110-GE Engine/F-110/129, F118; J85-5 Engine/J85-21B Engine; F-16 C/D; H-1 (T700 Engine)/H-60(T700 Engine); F/A-18 (F404-GE402 & J85 Engine); F-5 (F404-GE-402 & J85 Engine)/E-6B (F108 (CFM56) Engine, Propulsion, CF6-TF39 Engines); C-5 engine; A-10 (APG); B1 Aircraft; B2 Aircraft


This notice is not a Request for Proposals. There is no solicitation document available. Sources interested in prime and subcontracting opportunities should provide capability statements. Interested sources may submit a capability statement, no later than 9 December 2024. Additionally, sources aware of systems not previously mentioned in the list above, but that have knowledge of systems which require or will require CETS support during the stated time period, are requested to provide a capability statement and information identifying the platform(s). Capability statements must include total number of employees, professional qualification of personnel specifically qualified in the CETS areas outlined, whether a large or small business with respect to size standard identified below, and if a small business or other, include whether an 8(a) business, HUBZone, etc. Sources should also include, if applicable, information supporting any unique capability to provide services for specific aircrafts.


A determination by the Government not to compete these proposed requirements based upon responses to this notice is solely at the discretion of the Government. Security clearances may be required for the resulting contracts. Telephone statements will not be accepted. Routine communication concerning this acquisition shall be directed to John Manovich, Contract Specialist, john.manovich@us.af.mil, and Rebecca Rash, Contracting Officer, rebecca.rash@us.af.mil.
PSC Description: Technical Representation Services: Aircraft Components and Accessories

Solicitation Title: Request for Interested Manufacturers of C5M Engine Accessories
Description Text:
Sources Sought For C5 Engine Accessories 

(Request for Interested Manufacturers)

LOCATION:  Robins AFB, GA 31098-1813

SUBJECT:  Market research is being conducted to identify potential sources that may possess the expertise, capabilities, and experience to meet the requirements for purchase requirement of various C-5M engine accessories. 

ITEM DESCRIPTION:  The nineteen C5M Engine Accessories are as follows:

1560-01-600-9158UC, P/N: 255-2101-501 – Inlet Cowl, Inlet section of CF6-80C2 Engine. Guides air into turbofan engine.

4320-01-525-8855UC, P/N: 4H99002-101A – Engine Hydraulic Pump, Uses Engine power from accessory section to drive pump. Creates hydraulic pressure for aircraft systems to operate.

1560-01-618-7969UC, P/N: D52B1000-23 – Cowl Assy., Translating, Cowling that makes up the structure of both RH and LH Thrust Reverser Assembly.

1560-01-531-0842UC, P/N: 3114M98G01 – Door Assy., Blowout, Door panel used to access lower section of Thrust Reverser. Also used as pressure relief door in the case of a blown pneumatic line within engine compartment

1560-01-561-0165UC, P/N: 491B1213030-329 – Latch Assy., Forward, LH, Forward latch that secures Left Thrust Reverser to the closed position.

1560-01-561-0170UC, P/N: 491B1213030-330 - Latch Assy., Forward, RH, Forward latch that secures Right Thrust Reverser to the closed position

1560-01-592-5910UC, P/N: 224-2302-547 – Cowl Assy., Engine Core, RH, Cowling panel that encloses the right half of the engine core section

1560-01-592-8163UC, P/N: 255-2280-501 - Cowl Assy., Engine Fan, LH, Cowling that encloses the Left side fan section of the CF6-80C2 Engine.

1560-01-595-5844UC, P/N: 224-2301-523 - Cowl Assy., Engine Core, LH, Cowling panel that encloses the left half of the engine core section

1560-01-596-6401UC, P/N: 255-2281-501 - Cowl Assy., Engine Fan, RH, Cowling panel that encloses Right side fan section of CF6-80C2 Engine.

1560-01-611-6419UC, P/N: 4P39001-130A – RH Thrust Reverser, F138 P1, on the ground, the thrust reverser system slows the airplane, reducing the distance required to safely stop during landing. In the air, the thrust reversers on the inboard engines can be deployed to aid in rapid descent.

1560-01-620-9648UC, P/N: 4P39001-129A - LH Thrust Reverser, F138 P1, on the ground, the thrust reverser system slows the airplane, reducing the distance required to safely stop during landing. In the air, the thrust reversers on the inboard engines can be deployed to aid in rapid descent.

 1680-01-531-0837UC, P/N: 1806M46P05 – Lock, Actuation, Thrust Reverser, Locks T/R half by preventing the flexible shaft from turning until commanded to release by Center Drive Unit (CDU).

1680-01-631-3646UC, P/N: 491F1200301-031 – Drive Unit, Center LH, CDU powers the translating cowl via gearboxes, flexible shafts and three ball screw actuators.

1680-01-631-3650UC, P/N: 491F1200301-033 - Drive Unit, Center RH, CDU powers the translating cowl via gearboxes, flexible shafts and three ball screw actuators.

2840-01-567-5707UC, P/N: 491F1200302-005 – Actuator, End, Gearbox Lower, Each thrust reverser half is provided with two angle gearboxes and ballscrew actuators. Each is driven by the CDU through a flexible drive shaft to move the translating cowl.

4810-01-561-3018UC, P/N: 9191M34P02 - Actuator, Power Door Opener, Use to open and close Thrust Reverser Assy to aid in maintenance of engine and related components.

4820-01-554-6411UC, P/N: 9274M54P17 – Valve, Directional Pilot and Pressure Switch, It is a solenoid operated valve that changes an EEC electrical signal into a pneumatic air signal to control the direction of the Central Drive Unit (CDU) (deploy or stow).

6695-01-554-1937UC, P/N: 491F1200310-003 – Sensor, Position, Transcowl, The sensor continuously monitors the position of the translating cowl and transmits the position to both EEC channels.

Impediment to Competition:  The original equipment manufacturer for this item is General Electric (CAGE 062W0), which maintains its configuration by part number. The Government does not own any data, drawings, schematics, or any other releasable technical data in support of this requirement. As a result, General Electric is the only known source with adequate knowledge of the above C5M Engine Accessories performance requirements and possession of the required technical data and capabilities needed to produce this item and ensure compatibility of the equipment. 



INTEREST:  The DLA/AWB Contracting Office intends to award a sole source contract to General Electric for the manufacture of the nineteen C5M Engine Accessories in support of the C5M Program.  Other interested parties may identify their interest and capability to respond to the requirement no later than 15 days from the date of release of SSS date by emailing Donna Pallini at donna.pallini@us.af.mil and/or Vernell Ward at vernell.ward@us.af.mil.  The Government intends to procure these items using Other Than Full and Open Competition as prescribed by FAR 6.302-1, Only One Responsible Source and No Other Supplies or Services Will Satisfy Agency Requirements.



DISCLAIMER

This sources sought synopsis is for informational purposes only. This is not a request for proposal.  It does not constitute a solicitation, and shall not be construed as a commitment by the government.   Responses in any form are not offers, and the government is under no obligation to award a contract as a result of this announcement.  No funds are available to pay for preparation of responses to this announcement.   Any information submitted by respondents to this technical description is strictly voluntary.

(11) Anticipated Solicitation Number and Contract Award Number.FA812419R0002/FA812419D00**
(12) Contract Award Dollar Amount.TBD
(13) Line Item Number.See attachments
(14) Contract Award Date.TBD
(15) Contractor.Competitively established
(16) Description.The purpose is to establish a F138-GE-100 (CF6-802C-L1F) military variant engine depot-level maintenance sustainment support contract for the engine and its components, hereunder referred to as F138. The Contractor shall furnish to the United States Air Force (USAF) the labor and material necessary to accomplish sustainment support functions to overhaul and/or repair the F138 engines and components (referred to as Line Replaceable Units (LRUs)). The engine shall be built up in a complete Ready For Issue (RFI) power-plant package configuration (does not include thrust reverser, fan, or core cowls), tested and ready for immediate installation and use on the C-5M Aircraft. LRUs shall be returned in serviceable RFI status for field ordering and installation. Contract efforts also include depot maintenance of all F138 contract warranty and non-warranty items, transition support (including data required to support) for both phase-in and phase-out activities, Over & Above (O&A) work outside of normal Contract Line Item Number (CLIN) defined scope, travel, data deliverables, and systems reporting to support the F138 military variant engine program.Maintenance actions shall be conducted in accordance with (IAW) Engine Service Manuals (ESMs) for the engine and Quick Engine Change (QEC) and Component Maintenance Manuals (CMM) for the LRUs, Service Bulletins (SBs), Airworthiness Directives (ADs), 14 CFR Part 145 Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) certification requirements, USAF Time Compliance Technical Orders (TCTOs), and USAF / commercial best practices. The maintenance performed under this contract is anticipated to be On Condition Maintenance (OCM) for any end item generation (whole engine or LRU). For this effort OCM is defined as the disassembly to the extent necessary to determine condition of components, inspection, restoration or replacement of unserviceable exposed parts, reassembling, testing and adjustment of an item as necessitated and instructed by an item's governing technical data / maintenance manuals / SBs, and FAA requirements or equivalent to provide a serviceable item that is restored to a normal operating condition. The Contractor must obtain a Technical Data License agreement for the Original Equipment Manufacturer for the repair items or arrange a sub-contracting agreement with a party that contains the required OEM Technical Data License in order to perform the repair requirements of this PWS.This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; proposals are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued.Other Details:--NAICS: 336412 --Size Standard: 1500--CLINs: 0001: Transition Phase-InX002: Receiving Inspection &Teardown EvaluationX003: Incoming Evaluation TestX004: Whole Engine MaintenanceX005 thru X190 LRU Engine MaintenanceX191: O&A Labor & MaterialX192: DataX193: Travel--52.212-1, Instructions to Offerors-Commercial Items, applies to this acquisition. Details are attached hereto.--52.212-2, Evaluation-Commercial Items, is used, the specific evaluation criteria may be found in the attached document.--52.212-3, Offeror Representations and Certifications-Commercial Items, is incorporated. Offerors shall include a completed copy of the provision with their proposal.--52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions - Commercial Items, applies to this acquisition--52.212-5, Contract Terms and Conditions Required to Implement Statutes of Executive Orders - Commercial Items, applies to this acquisition--Please review all the attachments for further details/instructions
(17) Place of Contract Performance.Tinker AFB
(18) Set-aside Status.Unrestricted
The Government reserves the right to award no contract at all, depending on the quality of proposals submitted, the availability of funds, or for the Government's convenience. Proposal preparation/bidding costs will not be reimbursed.

Solicitation Title: F138 Program Management and Sustaining Engineering Services
Description Text:
The Government intends to award a 10 year, firm-fixed price, ID/IQ, contract for services. The RFP will be issued in accordance with (IAW) 10 U.S.C. 2304(c)(1) as implemented by FAR 6.302-1(a)(2)(iii).(1) Action Code.Pre-Solicitation | Sole Source(2) Date.April 12th (3) Year.2019(4) Contracting Officer Zip Code.73145(5) Product or Service Code.J028(6) Contracting Office Address.3001 Staff Drive | 2AA2 103CTinker AFB, OK 73145(7) Subject.F138 Program Management and Sustaining Engineering(8) Proposed Solicitation Number.FA812419R0001(9) Closing Response Date.13 May 2019 @ 5:30pm Central(10) Contact Point or Contracting Officer.Preston NunemakerContracting Officer405.734.6108preston.nunemaker@us.af.mil(11) Anticipated Contract Award Number and Solicitation Number.FA812419R0001/FA812419D0004(12) Contract Award Dollar Amount.TBN(13) Line Item Number.TBD(14) Contract Award Date.TBD(15) Contractor.General Electric (GE)(16) Description.The purpose is to establish a F138-GE-100 (CF6-802C-L1F military variant engine) services contract to the Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM), General Electric (GE) for Sustaining Engineering (SE), Program Management (PM), and Field Service Representatives (FSR) base support for the C-5M aircraft mission. The Contractor shall furnish to the United States Air Force (USAF) the labor and knowledge necessary to accomplish SE functions (including trending, diagnostics and analysis), logistics, PM, warranty administration, and FSRs to support USAF F138 bases: Dover Air Force Base (AFB) DE, Lackland AFB TX, Robins AFB GA, Tinker AFB OK, Travis AFB CA, Scott AFB IL, and Westover Air Reserve Base (ARB) MA. Additionally, FSR support may be required for any F138 en-route efforts as directed by the Government Procuring Contracting Officer (PCO) and Government F138 Cognizant Engineering Authority (CEA). This is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in Subpart 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; proposals are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued.
Other Details:-NAICS: 336412 -Size Standard: 1500-CLIN 0001 Transition Phase-InX002 FSRX003 PMX004 SEX005 FP Labor Wrap Rate (unscheduled efforts)X006 DataX007 TravelX008 Warranty Administration-52.212-4, Contract Terms and Conditions - Commercial Items, applies to this acquisition-52.212-5, Contract Terms and Conditions Required to Implement Statutes of Executive Orders - Commercial Items, applies to this acquisitionThis notice of intent is NOT a request for proposal. 1560-01-578-3704, PART NUMBER: 491B1220020-029, COVER,ACCESS,AIRCRAFT 
 
THIS IS A COMBINED SYNOPSIS/SOLICITATION FOR COMMERCIAL ITEMS PREPARED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE FORMAT IN FAR SUBPART 12.6, AS SUPPLEMENTED WITH ADDITIONAL INFORMATION INCLUDED IN THIS NOTICE. THIS ANNOUNCEMENT CONSTITUTES SOLICITATION SPE4A5-18-Q-0705.  PROPOSALS ARE BEING REQUESTED AND A SF 1449 SOLICITATION WILL NOT BE ISSUED FOR PR 73847460, NSN 1560-01-578-3704, COVER,ACCESS,AIRCRAFT.  THIS SOLICITATION IS FOR AWARD OF A FIRM FIXED PRICED CONTRACT UNDER FAR PART 12 FOR COMMERCIAL ACQUISITIONS.  THE APPROVED SOURCE IS:
GE Engine Services Distribution, CAGE 062W0, P/N 491B1220020-029
 
SOLICITATION WILL BE ISSUED ON AN UNRESTRICTED BASIS UTILIZING OTHER THAN FULL AND OPEN COMPETITION PROCEDURES UNDER 10 U.S.C. 2304(C)(1).  THIS IS NOT A SMALL BUSINESS SET-ASIDE.  NAICS CODE IS 336413 AND THE SMALL BUSINESS SIZE IS: 1250 EMPLOYEES.  THE PURCHASE REQUEST QUANTITY IS 35 EACH.  NO QUANTITY OPTION APPLIES. QUANTITY VARIANCE IS PLUS/MINUS 0%. DELIVERY: FOB ORIGIN, INSPECTION AND ACCEPTANCE AT DESTINATION. THE REQUIRED DELIVERY IS 259 DARO. THIS IS NOT A CRITICAL SAFETY ITEM (CSI) AND A FIRST ARTICLE TEST (FAT) IS NOT REQUIRED.  DPAS RATING FOR THIS ITEM IS DOC9. MILITARY STANDARD PACKAGING IS NOT REQUIRED.
 
SUBCONTRACTING PLAN IS NOT REQUIRED AS THE APPLICABLE $700,000 THRESHOLD IS NOT EXPECTED TO BE BREACHED.  EEO CLEARANCE IS NOT REQUIRED AS THE $10,000,000 THRESHOLD IS NOT EXPECTED TO BE BREACHED.  CERTIFIED COST OR PRICING DATA IS NOT REQUIRED AS THIS IS A COMMERCIAL ITEM UNDER $7,000,000.  PROGRESS PAYMENTS ARE NOT INCLUDED AS THE CONDITIONS AT FAR 32.501-2(C) HAVE NOT BEEN MET.  
 
**IMPORTANT NOTICE TO SUPPLIERS**
 
This NSN supports the F138 Engine for which there is a Warranty & Guarantee Program for the C-5 RERP Program encompassing the CF6-80C2L1F (F-138) Engine. Based on the terms and the agreement within this warranty, the Government must acquire F138 Engine parts from GE Engine Services Distribution, LCC (CAGE Code 062W0) in order not to breach the warranty for this engine, with the exception of standard hardware (screws & washers).
 
Therefore, offerors are put on notice that the NSN in this solicitation may only be from a single source; i.e. GE Engine Services Distribution, LLC (CAGE Code 062W0). Any other offers will not be accepted. Authority is in accordance with FAR 13.106-1(b)(2), which allows for soliciting from a single source when the acquisition value exceeds the SAT threshold where the contracting officer determines the circumstances of the contract action deem only one source reasonably available.
 
 
THE SOLICITATION ISSUE DATE IS ON OR ABOUT 7/19/2018. THE CLOSING DATE IS ON OR ABOUT 8/02/2018.
